snippet: Accused of being out of touch on social issues, Republicans face a question of gay rights at the federal level with the vote Monday to outlaw workplace discrimination against gay men, lesbians and transgender people.
abstract: Republicans, accused of being out of touch on social issues, face a question of gay rights at the federal level with crucial Senate vote on bill to outlaw workplace discrimination against gay men, lesbians and transgender people; bill is apparently just one vote short of threshold to prevent filibuster.
lead_paragraph: Accused of being out of touch on social issues, Republicans face a question of gay rights at the federal level with the vote Monday to outlaw workplace discrimination against gay men, lesbians and transgender people.

headline.main: Senate Vote on Workplace Bias Against Gays Poses a Test for the G.O.P.
headline.print_headline: Senate Vote on Workplace Bias Against Gays Poses a Test for the G.O.P.
